headline: Air Fryer Meatballs
description: Air fryer meatballs are quick, easy, and mess-free to make. The insides stay tender and juicy while the outsides brown up nicely. Serve with marinara.

video.description: After trying air fryer meatballs, I will never bake them in the oven again. The insides stay nice and tender while the outsides get a slight crisp on them. The best part is that you can make them ahead of time and freeze for later use.
video.name: Air-Fryer Meatballs Recipe

name: Air Fryer Meatballs

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Combine beef, pork, Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, egg, garlic, Italian seasoning, and salt in a large bowl. Mix until evenly combined. Form into 16 equal meatballs (a small ice cream scoop is helpful) and place on a baking sheet.

Place 1/2 of the meatballs in the basket of the air fryer and cook 8 minutes. Shake the basket and cook 2 minutes more. Transfer to a serving plate and let rest for 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining meatballs.

review.reviewBody: Super easy! My 7 year old made them with very little help. I changed the seasonings a bit just to our preferences, and served with egg noodles and a stroganoff sauce for the kid and the hubs. (I don't like stroganoff so I ate mine as "meatloaf bites" and dunked in steak sauce.) Will make again for sure!

The meat balls were easy to make in the air fryer. I cooked them 8 minutes, turned them over and cooked them for 4 minutes more. The meat was fresh not frozen. Crispy on the top and moist inside. Next time the meat will be frozen so I will cook them about 2 to 3 minutes longer. Enjoyed very much.
Really liked how these turned out! Much better than in the ovenâ€”tender inside with a brown crust outside. I did cook them at 375 instead of 350 and liked the result. Definitely a keeper!
Thank you! I am new to my air fryer and this really helped me not botch it up. Many thanks ðŸ˜Š

i made these for my fiancÃ© and he loved them. He said hes had plenty of meatballs, but these are by far the best. They are very easy to make which is important. Gonna make them again tonight for dinner. Wouldn't change a thing.

Used Ultrean air fryer, and modified the recipe (only 1lb beef, added 1/2 pack onion soup mix, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, egg) Made 16 meatballs. I preheated to 400, lowered to 380 and cooked the first 8 for 12 minutes - too long. OK, but too long. The next batch I cooked for 10 minutes, and they were perfect. I didn't need to toss or shake, because they moved around on their own.
I loved it...but I did add about two tbls of dill pickle relish...it gave it a zing
It needs longer cooking time in the airfryer

Very easy. Kept the meatballs plain as they're for my 16 year old toy poodle who has kidney issues. I was instructed to do this method by Dr Harvey's nutritional specialist. I'll do it this way for me too!
They tasted very good but I cooked them longer by 6 minutes. Total of 14 minutes. Also had to substitute to plain bread crumbs. Still had a good flavor. Thank You
I made these today! It was quick and not messy to brown them in the air fryer. Delicious!
Made these in the oven because its literally the same as an air fryer. One star off for that comment hahaha

This is a simple but amazingly good recipe. Only thing I did was add black pepper because I can't imagine beef without it. The parmesan is such a nice touch you don't even need or want a sauce. I had these with salad. Would be amazing with a red sauce though or even on pizza. Worth making. Thanks for the recipe!

Made these for the first time and went by the recipe. Wouldn't change a thing. Hubby says it's a keeper. I would make these again. Great thing is you can make these ahead of time and freeze. The only thing I wasn't sure of was the grated parmesan cheese. So I just used the grated in the bottle like you would serve w/spaghetti.
I had to substitute 4oz of mild Italian sausage for the ground pork but it turned out really well.
Great recipe! Very first time Iâ€™ve used my new air fryer. I made it as written-very tasty and super quick and easy.
All I did was make my special sauce to go with it but it's really good

Awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I made this with the following deviations:

1). Instead of pork, I used hot Italian sausage (Costco)

2). I ended up with 15 balls rather than 16.

3). I rolled the meatballs in parsley before cooking.

4). I cooked all 15 balls at once in the air fryer, using 350 degrees for 10 minutes, turning them over, then for another 10 mins.

Very, very tasty!!! 

I made 4 batches. Had one batch for dinner. The other three I will cook and freeze tomorrow, so I have "meatballs ready to thaw, heat and eat" for future meals.

So glad I found this recipe.
Wonderful! Thank you!
Really enjoyed these meatballs. Not too many ingredients which I like and I fried them in olive oil instead of using my air fryer. They were the perfect texture and flavor.
I made the recipe as written and they were perfect. My husband loved them and they were gone the next day. I won't fry or bake meatballs again. Fast and easy. Thanks for a great recipe.
Wonderful
This was great and I had a meatloaf mix in freezer. Beef, pork and veal. Added bacon bits!! It was the best, ever!!!
Great, But I use Beef, Veal & Pork 85/15 Ground Beef.
I had to adjust the time but these were great and easy to make
I had to change some of the ingredients in the recipe but was great to be able to make it. Tasted great.

Made mine with a venison and beef mixture. I also placed a small ball of mozzarella cheese in the middle and it was great! I used the same seasonings and put it in my Ninja Foodi. 8 min on the bake function and 4 in the air fryer function.

My go to recipe for meatballs!
Instead of ground beef and pork, used 1.5 lb. of ground venison. This recipe was delicious.
Came out great!
Just got the air fryer and was a little hesitant how these would come out. DELICIOUS! Made no changes to the recipe.

These were delicious. I made them smaller - slightly bigger than a golf ball and 10 min was good in air fryer. Used the two cloves of garlic but they were big cloves. They were still awesome. This one is a keeper.

What a great simple recipe! I quadrupled the recipe and was able to get half of all of my meatballs into my large air fryer. The flavor was great and my husband was extra happy that I didn't use onions to make them. The meatballs have great flavor and I look forward to making this again.
This recipe is so easy and so good. The only thing I did different is we only had elk meat instead of regular hamburger.

Really good. I was shocked that I actually had all the ingredients.
I made my meatballs the size of billiard balls so I had them in the air fryer for 14 minutes at 350. I used my meat thermometer to verify that they were cooked inside. I followed the recipe exactly as shown. Definitely use the ice cream scoop to make your meatballs uniform.
I added extra parmesan cheese because we loooove cheese and used teriyaki sauce to give it a lil bang it was soooo good!
Easy as cake! I made some adjustments for personal taste, but this is in HEAVY rotation in my house!
